H0.text: One cell divides into two cells is an example of asexual reproduction.

H1.text: Two cells unite to form one cell is an example of asexual reproduction.

H2.text: A gene in a cell mutates is an example of asexual reproduction.

H3.text: Egg cells are produced is an example of asexual reproduction.

A4.text: Prokaryotes (Archaea and Bacteria) reproduce asexually through binary fission, in which the parent organism divides in two to produce two genetically identical daughter organisms.

A5.text: Asexual reproduction is a type of reproduction that does not involve the fusion of gametes or change in the number of chromosomes.
